item.description: Confirmed! The Chrome and ChromeOS Follow site option will use RSS for Feeds in the side panel. Google will provide corpus content for sites without an RSS feed that you follow. Post updated with details. https://t.co/AnerYYPw9n
item.source:markdown: Confirmed! The Chrome and ChromeOS Follow site option *will* use RSS for Feeds in the side panel. Google will provide corpus content for sites without an RSS feed that you follow. Post updated with details. https://t.co/AnerYYPw9n

item.description: @apf Sweet and thanks. And it will use standard RSS? Just want to be sure.
item.source:markdown: @__apf__ Sweet and thanks. And it will use standard RSS? Just want to be sure.

item.description: @deanbarker @mattfcoop You should be fine with that use case. Would a newer device / CPU be faster? Sure, but for everyday basic and generic use you wouldn‚Äôt see much difference.
item.source:markdown: @deanbarker @mattfcoop You should be fine with that use case. Would a newer device / CPU be faster? Sure, but for everyday basic and generic use you wouldn‚Äôt see much difference.

item.description: @deanbarker @mattfcoop IMO, the Pixelbook Go sets the standard for speaker output on a Chromebook. The Dragonfly‚Äôs speakers aren‚Äôt quite as good but still well above what you‚Äôll find on the average Chromebook.
item.source:markdown: @deanbarker @mattfcoop IMO, the Pixelbook Go sets the standard for speaker output on a Chromebook. The Dragonfly‚Äôs speakers aren‚Äôt quite as good but still well above what you‚Äôll find on the average Chromebook.

item.description: @RyanLounsbury I suspect so. I personally like to get a Core i7 in just about every device I can. But I know from the HP that a Core i3 would probably do the trick for me. Think I‚Äôll take the Core i5 as a happy medium. ü§ì
item.source:markdown: @RyanLounsbury I suspect so. I personally like to get a Core i7 in just about every device I can. But I know from the HP that a Core i3 would probably do the trick for me. Think I‚Äôll take the Core i5 as a happy medium. ü§ì

item.description: @mattfcoop So far, no. However, the speakers are not very loud. I wonder if a software update reduced the power output.
item.source:markdown: @mattfcoop So far, no. However, the speakers are not very loud. I wonder if a software update reduced the power output.

item.description: @RyanLounsbury Very much so. The 12th gen Intel chips are architected with multiple performance and efficiency cores. There‚Äôs far less difference between a Core i3 and i5 from what I can see and based on reviewing the designs.
item.source:markdown: @RyanLounsbury Very much so. The 12th gen Intel chips are architected with multiple performance and efficiency cores. There‚Äôs far less difference between a Core i3 and i5 from what I can see and based on reviewing the designs.
